author: iSazonov
body:
As stated in #2887 each test must be performed on all supported platforms.

- [ ] We need a tool (script) to check this on every day basis
- [ ] We need to analyze test results (pester-tests.xml), identify the problems and correct tests

comments.author: lzybkr
comments.body: `pester-tests.xml` should now be published as an artifact - see #3003.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @lzybkr Thanks! I saw the PR. I found code sample for Appveyor but don't undestand how download the Travis artifact. Could you help me?

comments.author: lzybkr
comments.body: It looks like Travis is not like AppVeyor, the artifacts are private and we'd need to do something to share them.  I'm guessing @JamesWTruher knows much more than I, hopefully he can help.

comments.author: iSazonov

Is any updates?

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body:
The immediate issue I see is that Travis-CI only supports uploading artifacts to S3 and not Azure.  We can add a step at the end to upload pester-tests.xml to a public Azure blob.

cc @JamesWTruher

comments.author: JamesWTruher
comments.body: it should be possible to download the artifacts from S3. When we finish a test run it reports the upload path of the pester log. For example: run 2427.1 is uploaded to: https://s3.amazonaws.com/powershell-artifacts/PowerShell/PowerShell/2427/2427.1/pester-tests.xml

title: The same number of tests should run on any platform
